text.firstperson.title: FirstPerson Settings
text.firstperson.option.xOffset.@Tooltip: Moves the body relative to the camera back and forth
text.firstperson.option.sneakXOffset.@To: Moves the body relative to the camera back and forth while sneaking
text.firstperson.option.enabledByDefault: The default state of the FirstPerson mod after starting the game
text.firstperson.option.doll.Enabled.@To: Shows a smaller version of yourself(or the entity you're spectating) at the side of the screen
text.firstperson.option.doll.Size.@Toolt: Change the scale of the doll
text.firstperson.option.doll.LookingSide: Change how much the (locked) head looks to the left/right
text.firstperson.option.doll.LookingUpDo: Change how much the (locked) head looks Up/Down
When locked, the doll will look into the direction setup above, else it will look the same way the player does
text.firstperson.option.sitXOffset.@Tool: Moves the body relative to the camera back and forth while sitting
text.firstperson.option.playerSize.@Tool: Visually (in 3rd person) changes the player size
text.firstperson.option.modifyCameraHeig: Changes the first person camera height to the player size. This will cause issues with anticheats and might get you banned! Do not use on 3rd party servers!
text.firstperson.option.vanillaHands.@To: Shows the vanilla first person hands, but also the player model(but without arms)
text.firstperson.option.forceActive.@Too: Forces the FirstPerson Mod when other mods modify the rendering, but will cause visual issues(for example the players head is missing)
text.firstperson.option.layerMode.@Toolt: Head second layer rendering mode. VANILLA2D: Normal Minecraft second layer. RENDER3D: 3d second layer on nearby players. ONLYSELF: 3d second layer only on yourself
text.firstperson.option.optimizedLayerDi: Disables the 3d effect for other players that are further away in OPTIMIZED mode
text.firstperson.option.layerLimiter.@To: Hard limits how many other players will be rendered in 3d at a maximum. Yourself are excluded from this.
text.firstperson.option.skinLayerMode.@T: Same setting values as for the Head layer, but applies to the rest of the skin.
